src.data package¶

Submodules¶

src.data.make_dataset module¶

Functions to manipulate raw data.

Merge two flow files to produce a flow file for multiple years.

src.data.make_dataset.DeadInLFN(graph, dead_ids)¶

Get set of firms ids that are both dead and in the LFN.

src.data.make_dataset.FlowsPath(years, project_root='/Users/student/Dropbox/Mason/Mason_LFN/labour-flow-networks/docs/../src/data/../..')¶

Generates filepath for flows. input:

  • years: flow years to be used, in form ‘year1-year2’
  • project_root

output: flows filepath

src.data.make_dataset.GetDeadIds(input_filepath='/Users/student/Dropbox/Mason/Mason_LFN/labour-flow-networks/docs/../src/data/../../data/raw/16-12-2016-Mega/dates_death.csv', death_years='all', nrows=None)¶

Get firms that died in one of the years in death_years. Args:

  • input_filepath: filepath of dates_deat.csv with column format

firm_id, year. - death_years: range of years we wish deaths in with format ‘startyr-endyr’, or ‘all’ for all deaths. Deaths in the start year are included, deaths in the end year are not, so to get deaths in 2009 require ‘1996-2010’.

Output:
  • set : ids of firms that died in the specified period (or all firms

that died).

src.data.make_dataset.MakeFlowsDF(flow_years, nrows=None, manual_filepath=None)¶

Generates a new list of flows from two lists of flows. 1. Check to see if flow file already exists 2. If it doesn’t exist then create it from raw data files (might be quicker to do creation by pre-existing merged files but that would make the code harder...)

src.data.make_dataset.MakeLFN(flow_years, nrows=None, manual_filepath=None, print_info=True)¶

Make Labour Flow Network where one job change is sufficient for a link.

Args:
  • input_filepath: text file with col format
firm1_ID, firm2_ID, number - nrows: option to restrict the number of rows of flows read in. this allows for the creation of a smaller graph for testing.
returns:
  • networkx graph
src.data.make_dataset.StrFromYrs(year1, year2)¶

Create string in format ‘year1-year2’ from integers year1, year2

src.data.make_dataset.YrsFromStr(years)¶

Take string in format ‘year1-year2’ and return integers year1, year2

src.data.make_dataset_classes module¶

Functions for retrieving and doing basic manipulation of data to yield LFNs and sets of dead firm ids.

LFN (Labour Flow Network) class definition with several methods.

src.data.make_dataset_classes.DeadInLFN(graph, dead_ids)¶

Get set of firms ids that are both dead and in the LFN.

src.data.make_dataset_classes.FlowsPath(years, project_root='/Users/student/Dropbox/Mason/Mason_LFN/labour-flow-networks/docs/../src/data/../..')¶

Generates filepath for flows. input:

  • years: flow years to be used, in form ‘year1-year2’
  • project_root

output: flows filepath

src.data.make_dataset_classes.GetDeadIds(input_filepath='/Users/student/Dropbox/Mason/Mason_LFN/labour-flow-networks/docs/../src/data/../../data/raw/16-12-2016-Mega/dates_death.csv', death_years='all', nrows=None)¶

Get firms that died in one of the years in death_years.

Args:
  • input_filepath: filepath of dates_deat.csv with column format

firm_id, year. - death_years: range of years we wish deaths in with format ‘startyr-endyr’, or ‘all’ for all deaths. Deaths in the start year are included, deaths in the end year are not, so to get deaths in 2009 require ‘1996-2010’.

Output:
  • set : ids of firms that died in the specified period (or all firms

that died).

class src.data.make_dataset_classes.LFN(flow_years, nflow_rows=None, death_years=None, ndeath_rows=None)¶

Class of Labour Flow Networks.

  • Inherit from the class of networkx networks.
  • Make method: Create an LFN for the years specified
  • FilepathInfo method: return a string to be used as part of a filename

specifying the key details of the LFN

Node Attributes:
‘Dead’: dictionary mapping every node to True if node is dead or False if node is alive.
Data Attributes
dead_nodes: set of dead nodes.
AliveNodes()¶

Return set of nodes in LFN that are alive.

AllAlive()¶

Sets node attributes so that all nodes are marked as alive.

KillNodes(dead_ids)¶

Change node attributes for nodes in list dead_ids to Dead. Also updates the ‘dead_nodes’ list.

NodeDead(node)¶

Return True if node is dead and False if node is alive.

PrintInfo()¶

Print info on LFN.

UpdatedDegree(node)¶

Return the updated degree of the node. That means it is number of neighbours of the node that are alive.

src.data.make_dataset_classes.MakeFlowsDF(flow_years, nrows=None, manual_filepath=None)¶

Generates a new list of flows from two lists of flows. 1. Check to see if flow file already exists 2. If it doesn’t exist then create it from raw data files (might be quicker to do creation by pre-existing merged files but that would make the code harder...)
